patterns_reference.reason: Enemy AI patterns, projectile systems, wave management

canvas_patterns.reason: Advanced Canvas techniques for visual polish

forbidden_rules.feature_cascade: INCREMENTAL DEVELOPMENT ONLY - learned this the hard way in V2
forbidden_rules.skip_backups: BACKUP BEFORE CHANGES - saved the project in V2

gameplay.notes: Formation movement, wave progression, shield destruction, high scores all perfect

visuals.notes: V3 modern aesthetic - gradients, glows, starfield, particles. Massive upgrade from V1/V2

audio.notes: Intensity-responsive music, varied sound effects. Audio System extracted to shared-library

code_quality.notes: Clean OOP, well-organized. RULE 1 & 2 saved this project from V2 disaster

patterns_to_keep.why: V2 added everything at once = cascade failure. ONE feature at a time saved V3
V1 backup saved entire project when V2 broke. Could diff to find issues
Transformed game from retro to modern. Reusable pattern
Wave movement pattern works well, easy to extend
Persistence without backend, perfect for browser games
Audio System used in 3 games = ready for extraction. Worked perfectly

patterns_to_avoid.why: V2 cascade failure: particles + screen shake + shields + collision changes = impossible to debug
patterns_to_avoid.lesson: ONE feature at a time. Test after EACH change. Non-negotiable.

patterns_to_avoid.why: Shadow/alpha leaked between frames causing visual artifacts
patterns_to_avoid.lesson: save()/restore() or manually reset shadow/alpha after use

violations.fix: Returned to V1 backup, rebuilt V2 feature-by-feature

notes: Three versions taught critical lessons. V1 = fundamentals. V2 = learned Rule 1 & 2 the hard way (cascade failure). V3 = modern visual polish with proper incremental workflow. Audio System extraction validated Rule of Three. This game established the Hard Rules.
